body:
Comment 2: 
The go command stops at GOPATH workspace boundaries. If you tell it to build something
in one workspace it will not build stale things in other workspaces. With one exception:
if the thing in the other workspace has never been built at all, the go command will
build it instead of failing.

If you have one workspace per project you are not using them in the intended manner,
which will make the tools work less well for you. See http://golang.org/doc/code.html
for an overview.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
